snippet: While sales slipped from the torrid pace of last year, analysts said that average vehicle prices rose because of strong demand for higher-cost S.U.V.s.
abstract: Autodata releases report showing United States auto industry sold better-than-expected 1.15 million vehicles in January, decline of 0.3 percent from month one year earlier.
lead_paragraph: While sales slipped from the torrid pace of last year, analysts said that average vehicle prices rose because of strong demand for higher-cost S.U.V.s.

headline.main: Appetite for S.U.V.s Offers Upside in Slower Month for Auto Sales
headline.print_headline: Appetite for S.U.V.s Offers Upside in Slower Month for Auto Sales
